intro: Streblus lactescens, commonly known as the white milk tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and produces small, greenish flowers. Its latex sap is milky and has been used traditionally for various purposes. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and is often found in lowland forests.
